name: start-page[en].md
title: Home Page
html:
üè† Home Page

After launching the app, you land on the Home Page ‚Äî your starting screen and the main entry point to all key features.

What's on this page:

  • In the center, you'll see blocks titled "Last edited recipes" and "Last edited products". These give you quick access to the items you've recently worked on.
  • Each entry displays the item‚Äôs name and the time it was last modified. Clicking an item opens it for editing.

Top Navigation Bar (Header):

The navigation menu is located at the top of the screen and includes:

  • Home ‚Äî return to the main dashboard.
  • Recipes ‚Äî navigate to the full list of recipes.
  • Products ‚Äî browse all saved products.
  • Invoices ‚Äî view and manage invoices.
  • Settings ‚Äî adjust preferences, view policies, and manage personal data.
  • More ‚Äî access additional actions like sync or export.

name: creating-invoices[en].md
title: Invoice Editing Page
html:
üßæ Invoice Editing Page

This page allows you to create and edit an invoice with detailed order information ‚Äî including recipes, products, taxes, notes, and metadata. It‚Äôs used to generate a final invoice for your client.

‚öôÔ∏è General Principles

  • ‚úèÔ∏è All fields are editable only in the Draft status.
  • üîê Once the invoice is set to Issued, Paid, or Canceled, editing is disabled.
  • üí° If you manually edit the price per unit or the total, the value becomes ‚Äúlocked‚Äù ‚Äî it won‚Äôt update even if the linked recipe or product changes.
  • üîÅ If not edited manually, prices automatically follow updates in recipes/products.
  • üìÑ PDF generation is available in all statuses except Draft.

üìå Invoice Statuses

Status Description Editable
Draft Initial state. Everything is editable. ‚úÖ
Issued Finalized invoice. All prices are locked and cannot be edited. ‚ùå
Paid Marked as paid. Can only be changed to Canceled. ‚ùå
Canceled Canceled invoice. No changes allowed. ‚ùå

üîÅ Status Transitions

  • Draft ‚Üí Issued / Paid / Canceled
  • Issued ‚Üí Paid / Canceled
  • Paid ‚Üí Canceled
  • Canceled ‚Üí ‚ùå (locked)

üßæ Main Fields

  • Private name ‚Äî internal invoice name.
  • Prefix ‚Äî invoice group prefix.
  • Invoice number ‚Äî auto-generated ID.
  • Date issued / Due date ‚Äî issue and due dates for the invoice.

üè¢ Company and Client Info

  • Your company details ‚Äî free-text field. You can either write manually or insert pre-saved company info from settings.
  • Customer details ‚Äî same logic; enter manually or insert from saved client list.

üìã Line Items Table

You can add:

  • ü•£ Recipes ‚Äî price is pulled from the recipe calculation settings.
  • üì¶ Products ‚Äî price is taken from the product card.

üîÅ Prices include modifiers (if any).
üìù You can manually edit price per unit or total ‚Äî the other value will recalculate automatically based on quantity.

üßæ Taxes and Fees

  • Add with Add tax or fee button.
  • Choose from predefined options in your settings.
  • Both percentage and fixed amounts are supported.
  • Order matters: taxes/fees are applied sequentially.

üóíÔ∏è Notes and Terms

  • Notes ‚Äî additional comments or message for the client.
  • Terms ‚Äî legal or business conditions (e.g., payment policy, delivery terms).

üßÆ Invoice Footer

Displays:

  • Subtotal ‚Äî line item total before taxes/fees.
  • Tax ‚Äî total taxes applied.
  • Fees ‚Äî extra charges (like delivery).
  • Total ‚Äî final invoice amount.

üì§ Actions

  • Issue and download invoice ‚Äî locks the invoice (Issued) and generates a PDF.
  • Generate PDF ‚Äî available in all statuses except Draft.
  • Copy / Delete Invoice ‚Äî clone or remove invoice.
  • Mark as paid / canceled ‚Äî change invoice status manually.

name: invoices-overview[en].md
title: What are invoices?
html:
üßæ What are invoices?

Invoices are a system for generating and tracking bills for your orders. You can use them for:

  • üí∞ Calculating the total cost of an order based on recipes and products
  • üì¶ Tracking expenses and sales
  • üßæ Storing information about clients, order dates, and due dates
  • üßæ Generating final PDF documents to send to clients (in future versions)

Each invoice is a document that contains a list of items (recipes, products, or custom entries) with quantity, price, and total amount.

üìÑ Invoice List Page

This page displays all created invoices. Here you can:

  • ‚úÖ Create new invoices
  • üóëÔ∏è Select and delete multiple invoices
  • üëÅ View status, creation date, due date, and remaining days for each invoice

üîò Main elements

  • Create invoice button (‚ûï) ‚Äî opens the form to create a new invoice.
  • Select many ‚Äî activates multi-select mode for bulk actions (like deletion).
  • Invoice info includes:
    • Number ‚Äî the invoice ID, which includes a prefix, date, and random suffix (e.g., #UK-FR/20250707-8c)
    • Status ‚Äî can be Draft, Sent, Paid, etc.
    • Date due ‚Äî the invoice due date
    • Days left ‚Äî calculated automatically from the due date
    • Last edited date ‚Äî shown in the top-right corner

üìÇ Grouping by prefix

Invoices are grouped by prefix, which is part of the invoice ID and can be set manually or automatically during creation. The prefix appears before the date and is used for logical grouping.

üß† Tips

  • ‚úèÔ∏è Clicking the invoice name opens it for editing
  • ‚è± Days left are calculated automatically based on the due date
  • üóëÔ∏è Deletion is only available in multi-select mode
  • üïí Sorting and filtering will be available in future versions

name: adding-recipes[en].md
title: Creating and Editing a Recipe
html:
‚úèÔ∏è Creating and Editing a Recipe

A recipe is a combination of ingredients (products or sub-recipes) with defined quantities and optional output weight.
Each recipe can include a title, description, total yield, category, and tags for filtering and sorting.

üßæ Main Fields

üìõ Recipe Name

  • The top field is used to enter the recipe name (e.g., "Caramel Napoleon").

üìù Description

  • Below that is a free-text field for describing the method, mold size, portioning details, notes, etc.

‚öñÔ∏è Total Yield (optional but affects pricing)

  • This field defines the final yield of the recipe (e.g., 1000 g or 12 pcs).
  • If left empty, the total weight of all ingredients is used to calculate cost per gram or piece.
  • If filled, the system treats this as the actual yield, and pricing is based on that number ‚Äî useful when some mass is lost during preparation.

Recommended for baked goods, reductions, or recipes where weight loss occurs in the process.

üß© Ingredients

Each ingredient can be either:

  • ‚úÖ A product from your stock
  • üîÅ A sub-recipe

For each ingredient, you define:

  • Name (selected from list)
  • Quantity
  • Unit ‚Äî automatically pre-filled when you select a product or sub-recipe (grams or pieces)

You can mix both products and sub-recipes in a single recipe.
Click ‚ÄúAdd Ingredient‚Äù to insert a new row.

‚ûï Math Expressions

All numeric fields support math expressions, such as:

  • 100+20 ‚Üí 120
  • 400*2 ‚Üí 800
  • 200*0.75 ‚Üí 150
  • 100 + 10% ‚Üí 110

This allows for fast scaling, portioning, or converting recipes directly in the input fields.

üè∑Ô∏è Category and Tags

  • Category ‚Äî determines which group the recipe belongs to on the main list.
    Categories are managed in the Settings section.

  • Tags ‚Äî custom keywords for filtering and organizing recipes.
    Examples: vegan, filling, seasonal, decoration, base

üíæ Saving

  • Click ‚ÄúSave Changes‚Äù to store your recipe.
  • If you leave the page without saving, your changes will be preserved as a draft.

This page gives you full control over the structure, content, and cost of your recipes ‚Äî whether for planning, production, or invoicing.

name: calculation[en].md
title: Recipe Cost Calculation
html:
üìä Recipe Cost Calculation Page

This page displays the total cost of a recipe, suggested selling price, and breakdown by ingredient.

‚öôÔ∏è Calculation For

Specifies the number of units the recipe is calculated for:

  • Examples: 14 piece, 200 gram
  • Used to compute price per unit and total cost.

üí∂ Price Per Unit

Shows cost details for a single unit of the recipe:

  • Base cost ‚Äî calculated from ingredients.
  • Selling price ‚Äî adjusted with price modifiers.
  • Profit ‚Äî displayed in green.
  • Weight per unit ‚Äî if total output is set.
  • ‚û°Ô∏è Arrow shows that the price has changed due to modifiers.

üí∞ Total Cost

Displays the base total cost of the entire recipe (excluding modifiers).

üéõÔ∏è Price Modifiers

Allow you to define a selling price without changing the ingredient data:

  • Per unit or Total ‚Äî whether the modifier applies per unit or to the total.
  • Add or Round to ‚Äî add a fixed/percent value or round the price.
  • $ or % ‚Äî define the value format.

üßÆ If Total is selected, the unit price is recalculated:

unit price = total price / output quantity

üóëÔ∏è To remove a modifier, simply clear the amount field.

üìà Price and Weight Breakdown

Two pie charts:

  • By price ‚Äî shows each ingredient‚Äôs share of the total cost.
  • By weight ‚Äî shows each ingredient‚Äôs contribution to the total weight.

üßæ Ingredient Table

# Name Quantity Unit Price per unit Total cost
1 Dark chocolate 55% MAKRO 360 gram ‚Ç¨0.01795 ‚Ç¨6.46
2 Cream Makro 525 gram ‚Ç¨0.00423 ‚Ç¨2.22
... ... ... ... ... ...

üîó Clicking the name opens the ingredient or recipe details page.

üßÆ Table Footer Summary

  • Total weight ‚Äî always shown in grams (without modifiers).
  • Average price per gram ‚Äî based on all ingredients.
  • Total cost ‚Äî the sum of all ingredient costs.

name: recipes-overview[en].md
title: Recipes Overview
html:
üìñ Recipes

A recipe is the core data structure in the system. It consists of one or more products or sub-recipes, along with their quantities, units, and optional descriptions.
Recipes allow you to calculate precise costs, define composition, and include them in invoices.

üß≠ The Recipes Page

This page displays your full list of saved and draft recipes.

üóÇÔ∏è Grouping

By default, recipes are grouped by category, which you assign manually. You can also change the grouping method:

  • By category (default)
  • By tag
  • By creation date
  • By first letter

üîÑ Grouping Direction

Each group can be sorted in different directions:

  • From A to Z (alphabetically or from old to new)
  • From Z to A (reverse order)

üî† Inside Groups

Within each group, recipes are automatically sorted alphabetically.

‚úèÔ∏è Drafts

If you modify a recipe but haven‚Äôt saved it fully, it appears as a draft and is visually marked.
You‚Äôll also see a banner at the top showing the number of unsaved drafts.

‚úÖ Selection & Bulk Actions

  • Click a recipe card to enter selection mode
  • Once selected, you can:
    • Delete multiple recipes at once
    • Export selected recipes

üîÅ Import & Export

In the bottom right corner you‚Äôll find two buttons:

  • Export recipes ‚Äî download your recipes to a file
  • Import products ‚Äî upload products to use in recipes

Import/export is useful for transferring data between devices or using templates.

This section is the heart of the system. Here you combine ingredients, structure your ideas, and calculate the true cost of your creations.

name: buckups[en].md
title: Backups
html:
üóÑÔ∏è Backups

This section allows you to manually create and restore backups of your data.

This app is offline-first ‚Äî all your data is stored locally in your browser using secure storage (IndexedDB).
Because of this, it's highly recommended to make regular backups to avoid data loss in case of browser crashes, device resets, or accidental clearing of storage.

üü¢ Create Backup

  • Click Make a Backup to download a complete snapshot of your local data (products, recipes, invoices, settings, etc.)
  • The backup file will be saved to your device.
  • A timestamp indicates when the last backup was made.

üî¥ Restore Backup

  • Click Restore Backup to import a previously saved file.
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: This action will overwrite all current data in the app.
  • Useful for moving your data to another device or recovering a lost session.

We do not store any of your data on remote servers unless you explicitly enable cloud sync in the future.
Until then, you are the sole owner and guardian of your information ‚Äî make backups regularly.

name: categories[en].md
title: Category Management
html:
üóÇÔ∏è Category Management

The Categories tab in the Settings section allows you to manage product and recipe categories. Categorization helps you organize items, filter data, and group similar content for better clarity and reporting.

üì¶ Product Categories

Navigate to Product Categories to view and manage the list of all available product groups.

Each category is displayed in a list and includes:

  • The category name (e.g., "Glazes and coatings", "Oils and fats", "Gluten-free ingredients")
  • Actions:
    • ‚úèÔ∏è Edit ‚Äî rename the category
    • ‚ùå Delete ‚Äî permanently remove the category

To add a new category:

  1. Click on Add next to the section title.
  2. Enter a name in the input field.
  3. Click Save category to confirm.

‚ö†Ô∏è Deleting a category will not delete associated products, but those products will become uncategorized.

üßæ Recipe Categories

Similarly, click on Recipe Categories to manage how your recipes are grouped:

  • Create categories such as "Cakes", "Ganache", "Bases", "Decorations", etc.
  • This improves sorting and structuring in large recipe collections.

Categorization is optional but strongly recommended for keeping your data structured and easy to search or export.

name: credential-settings[en].md
title: Invoice Credentials
html:
üßæ Invoice Credentials

The Credentials tab allows you to define the sender and recipient details that will appear on generated invoices.

This section is divided into two subtabs:

  • System ‚Äì your own business details (used as the sender)
  • Customer ‚Äì predefined recipient data (coming soon)

üß∑ System Credentials

These fields are used to populate the sender block of each invoice. They are especially useful for legal, accounting, and tax purposes.

You can define multiple credentials if needed (e.g., for different legal entities, languages, or brands).

Fields (labels coming soon):

Although labels are not yet displayed in the UI, the input fields represent the following information (from left to right, top to bottom):

  1. Tax Identification Number ‚Äì e.g., VAT number or national tax number
  2. Country ‚Äì your legal country of registration
  3. Phone number ‚Äì for contact or support purposes
  4. Company name ‚Äì or your personal name as a freelancer
  5. Address ‚Äì your business or billing address
  6. Email ‚Äì for invoice replies or legal notices

‚ûï Actions

  • Add row ‚Äì create additional credential sets (e.g., for other branches or brands)
  • No changes ‚Äì indicator that there are no unsaved edits
  • ‚ùå Red cross ‚Äì remove the selected credential block

All entered information will be automatically inserted into every invoice PDF you generate.

Use this section to ensure that your invoices are properly identified and legally compliant.

name: invoice-settings[en].md
title: Invoice Settings
html:
üßæ Invoice Settings

The Invoice settings tab lets you customize the appearance and formatting of generated invoices.

üñºÔ∏è Logo

  • Upload logo ‚Äî allows you to upload your custom logo that will be displayed on all exported PDF invoices.
  • Recommended format: PNG with transparent background for best results.

üÜî Invoice Prefix

  • The Prefix for invoices field lets you define a custom prefix that will be prepended to each invoice number.
  • Examples:
    • UK-FR- ‚Üí results in UK-FR-001, UK-FR-002, etc.
    • 2025-INV- ‚Üí useful for year-based or categorized numbering

üìå The prefix is only visual and does not affect the invoice‚Äôs internal ID.

üî¢ Rounding Precision

The Precision section allows you to define how many decimal places are shown:

  • For rows ‚Äî number of decimal places for each invoice line item
    (e.g., 1.234 becomes 1.23 if precision = 2)

  • For totals ‚Äî number of decimal places for the total amount
    (2 is recommended for currency-based values)

These settings affect display only ‚Äî the internal calculations maintain full precision.

These settings allow you to tailor invoice formatting to match your brand and bookkeeping preferences.

name: language[en].md
title: Language Settings
html:
üåê Language Settings

The Localization section in the Settings page allows you to configure the interface language and default currency for the application.

üó£Ô∏è Interface Language

You can choose one of the available interface languages:

  • üáµüáπ Portugu√™s ‚Äî Portuguese
  • üá∑üá∫ –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π ‚Äî Russian
  • üá¨üáß English ‚Äî English

The selected language is stored locally and applied across the entire application.
Once selected, the interface updates automatically ‚Äî no page reload is required.

‚ùó Only one language can be active at a time.

üí± Currency

The Currency field accepts codes in the ISO 4217 format.
Examples include:

  • EUR ‚Äî Euro
  • USD ‚Äî US Dollar
  • RUB ‚Äî Russian Ruble

The selected currency is used throughout the app:

  • in recipe cost calculations
  • on generated invoices
  • in all displayed financial values

This section is essential for tailoring the app experience to your region and preferences.

name: taxes-and-fees[en].md
title: Taxes and Fees
html:
üí∞ Taxes and Fees

The Taxes section allows you to create, edit, and remove tax rates and additional fees that can be applied to recipes and invoices.

This flexible system is designed to support both VAT/IVA and extra charges (like delivery or rush fees).

üßæ Row fields

Each row includes:

  1. Name ‚Äì a descriptive label (e.g. Base IVA, Delivery anywhere, Urgent order)
  2. Description ‚Äì (optional) for internal notes, such as region or conditions
  3. Type:
    • % ‚Äì percentage-based (used for taxes)
    • üí∂ (no icon, just a number) ‚Äì fixed amount (used for surcharges/fees)
  4. Value:
    • If % is selected, the value is calculated as a percentage (e.g. 23%)
    • If percentage is not selected, it's treated as a fixed amount (e.g. 12.99)

‚ö†Ô∏è Currently, surcharges (fees) are always fixed. Percentage-based fees will be supported in the future.

‚ûï Actions

  • Add tax ‚Äì add a new row for tax or fee
  • ‚ùå Red cross ‚Äì delete the selected entry
  • No changes ‚Äì indicates that no unsaved edits are present

These values are used in recipe cost calculations and invoice generation. They help reflect actual pricing and ensure compliance with tax regulations.

name: adding-and-editing[en].md
title: Creating and Editing a Product
html:
‚úèÔ∏è Creating and Editing a Product

This page lets you create a new product or edit an existing one.
Products are used in recipes and invoices, so it‚Äôs important to set the correct price, weight, and category.

üßæ Fields and Elements

üß† Product Name

  • The top text field is for the product name (e.g., "Sugar", "Vanilla", "Flour T65").

‚öñÔ∏è Weight and Price

  • On the left: enter the amount or weight (e.g., 1 gram or 1 piece).
  • On the right: enter the price for the specified amount in your base currency (e.g., 0.023 ‚Ç¨).
  • You can switch between units: g or pcs (default is grams).
  • Clicking the ‚ûï icon opens a calculation widget:
    • For example: a widget to calculate the weight of eggs based on count and size.

üè∑Ô∏è Category

  • Choose a category that fits the product (e.g., "Dairy", "Flavors and Spices").
  • Categories are managed in the Settings section and make it easier to organize and search.

üõí Source

  • Optionally, enter the source ‚Äî store, website, or supplier where you usually buy this product.

‚ö° Quick Tags (Chips)

  • Below the Source field, you‚Äôll see quick tags ‚Äî the 5 most recently used sources.
  • Click a chip to instantly fill the Source field with that value.

üíæ Saving

  • The Save Changes button saves your product:
    • Either creates a new one
    • Or updates an existing entry if you're editing it

‚ùó If you leave the page without saving, your changes are kept as a draft ‚Äî but it‚Äôs better to save manually.

This screen gives you flexible control over your ingredients, ensuring every product has an accurate price, source, and classification for recipe cost calculation.

name: storage-overview[en].md
title: Stock (Products Page)
html:
üß∫ Stock (Products Page)

The Stock section is where you manage all ingredients and materials used in your recipes.
Each item on this page is called a product, and it has a price, unit, category, and edit history.

üóÉÔ∏è Page Structure

  • Products are automatically grouped by categories.
  • Items without a category appear at the top.
  • Each product displays the last edited timestamp in the top-right corner.

üìù Drafts

If you made changes to a product but didn‚Äôt save them, a message will appear at the top indicating unsaved changes.
Click the message to view or review your draft edits.

‚úÖ Selection Mode & Bulk Actions

Clicking on a product activates selection mode:

  • You can select multiple products at once.
  • After selection, bulk actions become available:
    • Delete selected products
    • Export selected products to a file

Available selection tools:

  • Select all
  • Hide selection
  • Clear selection from all

üîÅ Import & Export

At the bottom right of the screen, you'll find two key options:

  • Export products ‚Äî saves your product list to a file (for backup or transfer)
  • Import products ‚Äî uploads a file with product data (in a compatible format)

Importing will add new products and update existing ones if their IDs match.

üìå Sorting and Display

  • Products are always sorted by category, and within each category by last edited date.
  • The interface is optimized for speed and clarity, helping you quickly locate ingredients and keep data up to date.

This section is the foundation for cost calculations. Accurate product data = accurate recipe and invoice totals.
